[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: extension_proof()] [Hash Vector Manipulation] Is transaction_info_hashes() guaranteed to be computed from transaction_infos, or can it contain arbitrary hashes causing accumulator inconsistency? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/extension_proof()] [Clone Cost Attack] Does extension_proof() cloning frozen_subtree_roots and transaction_info_hashes allow memory exhaustion attacks with large accumulators, causing validator OOM? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: extension_proof()] [Empty Proof] Can extension_proof() be called when num_transactions_to_commit() is 0, creating invalid AccumulatorExtensionProof with empty hashes that breaks verification? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: transactions_to_commit()] [Array Bounds] Does transactions_to_commit() returning &execution_output.to_commit.transactions validate array bounds match transaction_infos, preventing out-of-bounds access? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: transaction_info_hashes()] [Hash Precomputation] Can ledger_update_output.transaction_info_hashes be precomputed incorrectly, not matching the actual hash of transaction_infos, allowing state commitment forgery? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: transactions_to_commit()] [Transaction Ordering] Is the ordering in execution_output.to_commit.transactions guaranteed to match statuses_for_input_txns, or can reordering cause nonce validation failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: num_transactions_to_commit()] [Zero Transactions] Can num_transactions_to_commit() return 0 while statuses_for_input_txns is non-empty, indicating all transactions failed but state was still modified? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: transactions_to_commit()] [System Transaction Injection] Does to_commit.transactions include only user transactions, or can attackers inject BlockMetadata/StateCheckpoint without proper authorization? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: subscribable_events()] [Event Filtering Bypass] Can execution_output.subscribable_events contain system events that should be filtered, allowing information leakage about validator operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: make_chunk_commit_notification()] [Event Cloning] Does make_chunk_commit_notification() cloning subscribable_events.get() cause race conditions where events are modified during clone? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: subscribable_events()] [Event Order] Are subscribable_events guaranteed to be in transaction execution order, or can event reordering confuse applications tracking state changes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: make_chunk_commit_notification()] [Planned Wait Abuse] Does subscribable_events.get(Some('wait_for_subscribable_events')) block indefinitely if Planned never resolves, causing validator hang? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: subscribable_events()] [Duplicate Events] Can execution_output.subscribable_events contain duplicate ContractEvents for the same transaction, causing double-counting in indexers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [Lifetime Violation] Does as_chunk_to_commit() returning ChunkToCommit<'_> with borrowed references allow use-after-free if StateComputeResult is dropped while ChunkToCommit is in use? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [First Version Mismatch] Can ledger_update_output.first_version() differ from execution_output.first_version, causing ChunkToCommit to reference wrong ledger position? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [State Update Refs] Does state_update_refs() return consistent references across multiple calls, or can mutations cause dangling pointers in ChunkToCommit? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [Is Reconfig Flag] Can is_reconfig be set incorrectly to true when next_epoch_state is None, causing storage layer to incorrectly handle epoch boundaries? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [State Reads Inconsistency] Are execution_output.state_reads guaranteed to match the actual state accessed during execution, or can stale cache cause verification failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [Transaction Output Mismatch] Can transaction_outputs length differ from transactions length in ChunkToCommit, causing indexing errors during commit? (High)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [Result State Corruption] Does result_state reflect all state changes in to_commit, or can partial execution leave result_state inconsistent? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/execution/executor-types/src/state_compute_result.rs] [Function: as_chunk_to_commit()] [Auxiliary Info Mismatch] Can persisted_auxiliary_infos have different length than transactions, causing auxiliary data to be associated with wrong transactions? (High)
